name: Polymer - Wheels up
author: Anastasiia Pushkina
description:
This workshop will teach you how to write Web Components that extend existing HTML elements and define new ones.


Polymer is a new technology, built atop Web Components, that enables developers to do so. With Polymer and Web Components, we can componentize the web! The goal of this workshop is to get a “hands on” experience with Google’s Polymer technology. By the end of the course you'll have walked through of what is Polymer, how to use a Polymer Element and how to create a Custom Element with Polymer.
prerequisites: There are no special prerequisites, this is an entry-level course.
preparations:
1. Install the current LTS version (4.x) of Node.js or newer.
2. Install the latest version of Bower. (npm install -g bower)
3. Install Polymer CLI. (npm install -g polymer-cli)


You're all set. Run polymer help to view a list of commands.


When you come to the course, we expect that you have a working `polymer` command in your terminal.
